title: EastEnders spoilers: Danny Dyer teases 'brilliant' Christmas Day episode
text:
The festive season is always an explosive one down in Walford, and Danny Dyer — who plays Mick Carter in the BBC One soap — has teased that this year’s holiday instalment of EastEnders will be particularly enjoyable for viewers during an appearance on The One Show.

Christmas might be a time for celebrating but, in Walford, it’s rather the opposite for the borough’s residents, as dark secrets have a nasty habit of coming to light — and death and destruction can often ensue. This year, viewers will see the culmination of the long-running ‘Sheanu’ affair narrative, as Sharon (Letitia Dean) and Keanu’s (Danny Walters) dalliance is revealed in no doubt an epic fashion.

Speaking on The One Show about what viewers have to look forward to this holiday season, Danny said: ‘It’s the most important ep of the year, Christmas Day.’

‘It’s powerful. There’s always a knees-up, but there’s always going to be some sort of a punch-up going on.’

While the ‘Sheanu’ storyline will seemingly take centre stage on Christmas, Danny suggested that several other characters will also be involved in the festivities — or, in EastEnders’ case, the lack thereof — saying: ‘It’s brilliant this year. Every year is brilliant but this year, it’s a culmination of many storylines coming together.’

What will Christmas have in store for the Carter clan? Danny’s character Mick is currently at the centre of a huge storyline which has seen him suffering from panic attacks. The stress of this coupled with his worries about son Ollie — not to mention wife Linda’s (Kellie Bright) recent cancer scare — has made it an incredibly tough year for the Queen Vic landlord, so Christmas will no doubt be equally stressful.

Senior Executive producer Kate Oates has already teased that Mick and Linda will be heavily featured during the show’s 35th anniversary next February, so it’s possible that the groundwork for their big narrative will be set during the Christmas episodes.

Speaking of the Christmas episodes, Danny is currently filming festive instalments of the BBC One soap and, as a result, he joked about how odd it is having the decorations up so early.

He said: ‘There’s a lot of pressure on it, and it is weird having all the decorations up. Our decorations went up, end of September.’
